question_text: Which of the following are true of MANs? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: They often use fiber optics for backbone connectivity
They are typically larger than WANs
They may be owned and maintained by cities or utilities
They span a wider area than LANs but less than WANs
correct_answer: They often use fiber optics for backbone connectivity
They may be owned and maintained by cities or utilities
They span a wider area than LANs but less than WANs
explanation: MANs are city-sized networks, often managed by local authorities or ISPs. They use high-speed links like fiber but are more localized than WANs.
